A Smart Trash Can: This trash can comes equipped with a built-in compactor, which helps to reduce the amount of space taken up by the can. It also has a sensor that detects when the can is full and automatically alerts the user to empty it. Additionally, the can has a touchscreen display that allows users to sort their trash into different categories, such as recyclables, compostables, and non-recyclables.

A Trash Can with a Built-In Recycling Bin: This trash can has a separate compartment within the can that is specifically designed for recyclables. The compartment has a special liner that separates the recyclables from the rest of the trash, making it easier to sort and recycle.

A Trash Can with a Movable Lid: This trash can has a lid that can be moved up and down, allowing users to easily access the contents of the can without having to lift the entire can. This can be especially useful for people with mobility issues or those who have difficulty bending down to reach the bottom of a traditional trash can.

A Trash Can with a Filter: This trash can has a built-in filter that helps to keep the trash inside the can clean and free of odors. The filter can be easily removed and replaced when it becomes dirty, and it can be washed and reused multiple times.

A Trash Can with a Built-In Composter: This trash can has a special compartment within the can that is specifically designed for composting food waste. The compartment has a special liner that breaks down the food waste into a nutrient-rich compost that can be used in gardens or houseplants. This can help to reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfills and create a more sustainable and eco-friendly way to dispose of food waste.
